entry.title: [GRA/BHS/DE/VA][Public Cloud] - Registries upgrade
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Apr 16, 08:00 - 16:00 UTC

Mar 5, 23:21 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Managed Private Registry.

Start time : 16/04/2025 08:00 UTC
End time : 16/04/2025 16:00 UTC
Service impact : The upgrade of the Harbor version will set Harbor in read-only mode (only pull will be allowed) for 1 or 2mn.
Service improvement : Following our continuous improvement policy, we are rolling out an upgrade of registries.

Thank you for your understanding.

entry.title: [WAW1][Containers & Orchestration] - Workflow Management maintenance notification
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 24, 14:30 - 15:30 UTC

Mar 12, 00:15 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Workflow Management service.

Start time : 24/03/2025 14:30 UTC
End time : 24/03/2025 15:30 UTC
Service impact : Workflows in progress at the start of the maintenance will be stopped and will be restarted automatically after the maintenance, if you have any workflows scheduled to run during the maintenance window, we recommend rescheduling them.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we will be doing a maintenance on our Workflow Management service.

Thank you for your understanding.

entry.title: [GLOBAL][Containers & Orchestration] - Managed Kubernetes Service maintenance notification
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 20, 09:00 - 17:00 UTC

Mar 11, 23:41 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Managed Kubernetes Service.

Start time : 20/03/2025 09:00 UTC
End time : 20/03/2025 17:00 UTC
Service impact : None
Service improvement : The default Loadbalancing solution for Managed Kubernetes Services (MKS) is being deprecated and replaced by a new one (Octavia).
Some obsolete and unused Load Balancers created through Managed Kubernetes Services will be suspended.

Thank you for your understanding.

entry.title: [GRA11][Public Cloud] - Internal databases update
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 19, 18:00 - 21:00 UTC

Mar 12, 15:41 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled for update the Internal databases on GRA11 region.

Start time : 19/03/2025 18:00 UTC
End time : 19/03/2025 21:00 UTC
Service impact : The API service may be unavailable during maintenance.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we are upgrading the database behind OpenStack Neutron API on GRA11 region.
During that period, the API may be slower and not answering at all.
Your instances, routers, load balancers, networks or any other existing OpenStack components are NOT affected.
Only creation, update or deletion could be affected.

Thank you for your understanding.

entry.title: [EU/CA/APAC][Public Cloud] - Keystone API incident notification
entry.content:
Mar 12, 18:50 UTC
Update - We are currently experiencing an incident affecting our Compute - Instance offering, which is causing temporary latency issues in EU region.

Here is detail for this incident :
Start time : 12/03/2025 18:20 UTC
Impacted Service(s) : Keystone (authentication) API has an increased error response rate for OpenStack - Object Storage and Managed Kubernetes Service.
Customers Impact : Clients using the Keystone API (authentication) are temporarily experiencing an increased error response rate for OpenStack - Object Storage and Managed Kubernetes Service for EU/CA/APAC region.
Ongoing Actions : Our teams are investigating to determine the origin of the incident to fix it.

We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.
We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Mar 12, 18:49 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Mar 12, 18:40 UTC

Customers Impact : Clients using the Keystone API (authentication) are temporarily experiencing an increased error response rate for OpenStack - Object Storage and Managed Kubernetes Service for EU/CA/APAC region.
Ongoing Actions : Our teams are investigating to determine the origin of the incident to fix it.

entry.title: [GRA11][Public Cloud] - Network API/Managed Kubernetes Services Incident notification
entry.content:
Mar 7, 05:21 UTC
Resolved - We would like to inform you that the incident on our Public cloud offer has now been resolved.

Here is detail for this incident :
Start time : 06/03/2025 20:27 UTC
End time : 06/03/2025 21:50 UTC
Root cause : This incident was caused by a software issue.

We thank you for your understanding and patience throughout this incident.

Mar 6, 21:51 UTC
Monitoring - We have new information regarding the incident that affected your service.

Please find below an update on the situation:
Update : Customers are able to perform API actions which involve an Openstack Network.
Slowness is no longer observed while performing API actions.
Ongoing Actions :Our teams are currently monitoring the situation.

Mar 6, 21:43 UTC
Update - We have new information regarding the incident that affected your service.

Please find below an update on the situation:
Update : Since 21:36 UTC, customers are able to perform API actions which involve an Openstack Network.
But slowness might be observed while performing API actions.
Ongoing Actions :Our teams are fully engaged and working to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Mar 6, 20:47 UTC
Identified - We are currently experiencing an incident affecting our Public cloud offering, which is causing temporary Availability issues in the GRA11 region.

Here is detail for this incident :
Start time : 06/03/2025 20:27 UTC
Impacted Services : Network API
Customers Impact : Customers are not able to perform API actions which involve an Openstack Network. This includes Instance spawn, loadbalancer failover etc...
Root cause : This incident is caused by a software issue.
Ongoing Actions : Server load is steadily decreasing following the initial incident, and we are monitoring the region.

We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.
We apologise for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Mar 6, 16:58 UTC
Identified - We are currently experiencing an incident affecting our Public cloud offering, which is causing temporary Availability issues in the GRA11 region.

Here is detail for this incident :
Start time : 06/03/2025 04:00 UTC
Impacted Services : Network API in the GRA11 region is degraded.
Customers Impact : Actions performed for updating existing load balancers or creating new ones will result in API errors. For Network API, services are degraded or response time is increased. Current load balancers remain active.
Ongoing Actions : Our teams are investigating to determine the origin of the incident to fix it.

Our teams are fully engaged and working to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.
We apologise for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.
